author: Tara Suter
description: Rep. Chip Roy (R-Texas) said Sunday the “real story” of the deadly flooding in Texas is the “heroism of those who showed up” to help, as opposed to who might be to blame. “I think the real story is not all the finger-pointing that the media wants to point to. It’s the heroism of those…
title: Chip Roy on Texas flooding: ‘Real story’ is ‘heroism of those who showed up’ to help

author: Sarah Fortinsky
description: Former New Jersey Gov. Chris Christie (R), an outspoken critic of President Trump, said the president benefited from the conspiracy theories surrounding the case of disgraced financier and convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein. In an interview on ABC News’s “This Week,” Christie pushed back on the suggestion that it was mostly the people around Trump…
title: Christie says Trump ‘benefited’ from Epstein conspiracy theories

author: Nathaniel Weixel
description: Hospitals are bracing for the impact from the Medicaid cuts in President Trump’s sweeping spending and tax cut law.   While most of the cuts won’t happen immediately, rural facilities in particular say they likely will have to make difficult financial decisions about which services they can afford to keep and which may need to…
title: Hospitals across nation brace for Medicaid cuts under ‘big, beautiful’ law

author: The Associated Press
description: ″This is now the time for negotiations,″ European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen told reporters in Brussels on Sunday.
title: The EU delays retaliatory tariffs on US goods in hopes of reaching a deal soon

author: The Associated Press
description: It's the first time a new round of severe weather has paused the search since the flooding earlier this month.
title: Amid new flood warnings, emergency crews suspend search for flooding victims in Texas

author: Sarah Fortinsky
description: Rep. Mike Lawler (R-N.Y.) said on Sunday he plans to speak soon with President Trump to discuss a path forward as he considers whether to launch a bid for governor in New York. Entering the state-wide race would likely pit him against Rep. Elise Stefanik (R-N.Y.), who is gearing up to launch her own campaign…
title: Lawler says he’ll meet with Trump soon to talk about potential run for NY governor

author: John Mac Ghlionn, opinion contributor
description: Elon Musk's "America Party" is a far cry from Ross Perot's third-party bid in 1992, as Musk's reliance on government funding, lack of policy substance, and social media antics make him an unlikely candidate for political success.
title: Elon Musk is no Ross Perot

author: Sarah Fortinsky
description: Kentucky Governor Andy Beshear (D) sharply criticized the administration’s sweeping tariffs, saying the policy approach amounts to “chaos” and is bad for the U.S. economy. “No, not at all,” Beshear said in an interview on NBC News’s “Meet the Press,” when asked whether the people of Kentucky voted for this tariff agenda. “This is, what…
title: Beshear blasts Trump tariffs: ‘It is chaos. It is increasing costs’

author: Rachel Scully
description: President Trump’s border czar, Tom Homan, said that his words were “taken out of context” when he said that federal immigration agents can detain people “based on their location, their occupation, their physical appearance.” During an interview on CNN’s State of the Union, Homan said that physical “can’t be the sole reason to raise reasonable suspicion,” but…
title: Homan says physical appearance ‘can’t be the sole reason to raise reasonable suspicion’

author: Mark R. Whittington, opinion contributor
description: NASA spending measures are tucked inside the bill that can best be described as ugly, or at the very least ill-advised.
title: NASA funding is an ugly casualty of the ‘big, beautiful bill’

author: Alex Gangitano
description: President Trump’s envoy for special missions, Richard Grenell, is causing tensions within the State Department as critics say his “freelancing” is damaging U.S. diplomatic negotiations and threatening national security. The most recent controversy includes a botched effort to secure the release of Americans unjustly detained in Venezuela that fell apart because Grenell and Secretary of…
title: Tensions between Rubio, Grenell flare over Venezuela deals

author: Sarah Fortinsky
description: Kentucky Gov. Andy Beshear (D) declined to rule out a possible bid for the White House when asked in a Sunday interview about his 2028 ambitions. Beshear noted he will serve as head of the Democratic Governors Association next year and is looking forward to winning “a lot of races that people aren’t expecting.” “And…
title: Beshear won’t rule out 2028 presidential bid: ‘We’ll see’

author: Sarah Fortinsky
description: Sen. John Barrasso (R-Wyo.) on Sunday said he has confidence in Attorney General Pam Bondi despite reports that she is feuding with FBI Director Kash Patel and Deputy FBI Director Dan Bongino over her handling of the case related to disgraced financier Jeffrey Epstein. “I do,” Barrasso said, when asked in an interview on NBC…
title: Senate Republican: ‘America is safer with Pam Bondi as attorney general’

author: Rachel Scully
description: Homeland Security Secretary Kristi Noem criticized a ruling from a federal judge that bars the Trump administration from using “unconstitutional” immigration enforcement efforts in parts of California, saying judges are “getting political” and that it is “not their job.” During an interview on “Fox News Sunday,” Noem was asked about the Friday ruling from U.S. District Judge Maame E. Frimpong, an…
title: Noem on blocked ICE operations ruling: Judges are ‘getting too political’

author: Alissa Hatfield and Naomi Charalambakis, opinion contributors
description: Using a variety of models helps to ensure that the best research is being done to benefit patients and their families.
title: Promising technologies are not yet ready to replace animal research

author: Sarah Fortinsky
description: Homeland Security Secretary Kristi Noem defended the conditions at the “Alligator Alcatraz” facility in Florida after Democrats made claims of “inhumane” treatment of the detained migrants. In an interview on NBC News’s “Meet the Press,” moderator Kristen Welker asked Noem about claims from Democrats that, in the facility, more than 30 people are “stuffed into…
title: Noem defends conditions at ‘Alligator Alcatraz’ detention facility

author: Sarah Fortinsky
description: Homeland Security Secretary Kristi Noem denied reports suggesting the deployment of resources to Texas was delayed because of her new rule requiring her personal sign off on all FEMA contracts or grants over $100,000. In an interview Sunday on NBC News’s “Meet the Press,” Noem acknowledged that she implemented the new rule but said the…
title: Noem on claims that new FEMA rule delayed resources to Texas: ‘Absolutely false’

author: Adonis Hoffman, opinion contributor
description: In recent years, major banks have begun the quiet, calculated and often callous closing of bank accounts belonging to honest, law-abiding Americans, typically without warning, cause or recourse.
title: Debanking innocent Americans should be illegal

author: Sarah Fortinsky
description: Tech billionaire Elon Musk blasted President Trump on Saturday over his defense of Attorney General Pam Bondi and her handling of the case related to disgraced financier Jeffrey Epstein. Musk, in a post on the social platform X late Saturday, responded to another X user, who screenshotted Trump’s Truth Social statement earlier that day and…
title: Musk slams Trump defense of Bondi on Epstein controversy: ‘Just release the files as promised’

author: Abraham Cooper, opinion contributor
description: For its success, the Gaza Humanitarian Foundation has been rewarded with cheers from the Palestinian people in Gaza, as well as robust international condemnation.
title: GHF is actually feeding Gazans, not letting Hamas extort them — and paying a price

author: Sarah Fortinsky
description: The Justice Department moved to dismiss charges against a Utah plastic doctor charged in connection with a COVID-19 fraud scheme, Attorney General Pam Bondi announced on Saturday. Michael Kirk Moore Jr. and three of his associates were indicted by a federal grand jury in January 2023 and accused of discarding more than $28,000 worth of…
title: DOJ drops charges against Utah doctor accused of throwing away COVID vaccines, distributing fake vaccination cards

author: Filip Timotija
description: President Trump claimed during an interview on Saturday that some Democrats in Congress “wanted to vote” for his “big, beautiful bill,” which was signed into law last week.  “And remember this, the Democrats wanted to vote for it, most of them, many of them, because it’s all good stuff,” the president said during his appearance…
title: Trump claims Democrats ‘wanted to vote’ for ‘big, beautiful bill’

author: Filip Timotija
description: Elon Musk’s artificial intelligence (AI) company xAI apologized to users for antisemitic posts authored by its chatbot Grok, pinning the blame on an update after conducting an investigation.  “First off, we deeply apologize for the horrific behavior that many experienced,” the company said in a lengthy post on social media platform X. “Our intent for@grok…
title: Grok issues apology after antisemitic posts controversy
